senses.de: Something that works by itself without needing a person to control it.
senses.ex: The door opens automatically when you stand in front of it.

Tips.title: No Human Needed
Tips.description: Automatic implies a process requires no human effort to function continuously.
Tips.example: The automatic irrigation system waters the garden by itself.

Tips.title: Tech Dependence
Tips.description: Many modern innovations rely on automatic features for efficiency and convenience.
Tips.example: Her house is fitted with an automatic climate control.

senses.de: Something that happens without having to think or decide to do it.
senses.ex: Breathing is an automatic function of the body.

Tips.title: Subconscious Actions
Tips.description: Automatic in a biological sense relates to actions your body does without conscious thought.
Tips.example: Her automatic response to the question showed she was prepared.

Tips.title: Common Phrases
Tips.description: There are popular phrases like 'automatic reaction' that imply no deliberate planning.
Tips.example: He ducked out of the way in an automatic reaction.

senses.de: Refers to a car or other vehicle with an automatic gear system.
senses.ex: Driving an automatic car is easier than driving one with a manual gearbox.

Tips.title: Driving Context
Tips.description: When learning to drive, 'automatic' often contrasts with 'manual' concerning transmission.
Tips.example: She preferred an automatic car for easy city driving.

Tips.title: Ease of Use
Tips.description: Vehicles with automatic features are often advertised as user-friendly.
Tips.example: The motorcycle's automatic gears make it simple to ride.

senses.de: Something that is automatic is certain to happen as a result of a rule or policy
senses.ex: If you are late three times, you will receive an automatic penalty.

Tips.title: Guaranteed Outcome
Tips.description: 'Automatic' can mean an outcome is guaranteed by rules, without room for discretion.
Tips.example: His top test scores guaranteed him an automatic place on the team.

Tips.title: Consequence Awareness
Tips.description: Awareness of automatic consequences might influence people's decisions or behaviors.
Tips.example: The automatic fine for littering discourages people from doing it.

senses.de: Refers to a firearm that can fire continuously as long as the trigger is pressed
senses.ex: The suspect was armed with an automatic weapon.

Tips.title: Continuous Firepower
Tips.description: 'Automatic' weapons can fire multiple rounds with one trigger pull.
Tips.example: Soldiers are trained to use automatic rifles in combat.

Tips.title: Military Associations
Tips.description: ‘Automatic’ can have a militaristic or violent connotation due to its association with weapons.
Tips.example: Action movies often feature heroes brandishing automatic weapons.

Instinctive.wordDefinition:
Instinctive refers to something that is done as a result of innate behavior or natural impulse. For example, a baby's ability to suckle for milk is instinctual.

Automatic can describe actions that are learned through repetition, while instinctive describes actions that are innate or natural.

Activities such as typing, driving, or playing an instrument can become automatic with practice, while actions like breathing or blinking are instinctive.

Involuntary.wordDefinition:
Involuntary refers to actions or responses that are done without intending to do them, but cannot be consciously controlled.

For example, blinking, shivering, or sneezing are involuntary actions that happen automatically, but we can't stop them from happening.

Automatic refers to actions that are done without conscious effort or thought, while involuntary refers to actions that happen automatically without conscious control.

Mechanical.wordDefinition:
Mechanical refers to a system or device that is operated by a human, using mechanical parts. For example, a mechanical watch works through the movement of gears and springs, which are powered by the winding of a spring by a person.

Automatic refers to something that runs by itself while mechanical refers to something operated by a person using mechanical means.

Reflexive.wordDefinition:
Reflexive refers to an involuntary or automatic response to a stimulus or situation. For example, when someone touches a hot stove, their reflexive response is to immediately withdraw their hand.

Both words describe actions that occur without conscious thought, but automatic usually describes actions that have been learned through deliberate practice, while reflexive describes innate responses that happen without thought.

Robotic.wordDefinition:
Robotic refers to a device or process that is controlled by a computer program and can perform complex tasks that require some intelligence.

For example, a robotic arm can perform delicate surgery on a patient with precision and accuracy.

Automatic refers to a device that can work on its own, whereas robotic refers to a device that can work on its own and can perform complex tasks with some intelligence involved.

Routine.wordDefinition:
Routine refers to a set of actions that are performed regularly, often in a specific order. For example, brushing your teeth before bed is part of many people's nightly routine.

Automatic is applicable to actions that are almost like reflexes or instinctual, while routine is applicable to actions that we consciously choose to do as part of a structured set of actions.

Spontaneous.wordDefinition:
Spontaneous means that something happens naturally or without any planning. For example, a sudden outburst of laughter or an unplanned adventure can be spontaneous.

Spontaneous is often used to describe things that happen unexpectedly or without planning, like a spontaneous party or a spontaneous act of kindness.

Automatic refers to something that happens without conscious thought, while spontaneous refers to something that happens naturally or unexpectedly without any planning.

Unconscious.wordDefinition:
Unconscious refers to something that is done without awareness or control. For example, breathing is an unconscious action, meaning it happens automatically without needing to think about it.

Automatic is applicable when someone is doing something without thinking, but can still control it, and unconscious is applicable when something is happening automatically, without any awareness or control.

quotes.Text: In the military I could exercise the power of being automatically respected because of the medals on my chest, not because I had done anything right at the moment to earn that respect. This is pretty nice. It's also a psychological trap that can stop one's growth and allow one to get away with just plain bad behavior.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Karl Marlantes

quotes.Text: Every time I've been offered a new job, I've automatically said, 'Oh, I don't think you want me for that job.' It's sort of a weird female - or, at least, it is in me - a weird female defense, when, in fact, what you want to do is scream, 'Hooray, I want to do this!
quotes.Title: American Editor
quotes.Name: Joanna Coles

quotes.Text: A few people have asked me about the women agenda on country radio. I can only speak for myself on this, and all I have to say is that I'm very grateful, and thankful, that country radio has been so automatically accepting, and supportive, of me and my music.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Gabby Barrett

quotes.Text: I think great writers should write great shows, and I have trouble with, like, what you are in life shouldn't automatically make you what you do in your art. It doesn't necessarily translate.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Jenji Kohan

quotes.Text: Almost any difficulty will move in the face of honesty. When I am honest I never feel stupid. And when I am honest I am automatically humble.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Hugh Prather

quotes.Text: There are no automatic links between poverty and terrorism. Among millions of poor people in the world, only a few turn to terrorism.
quotes.Title: Dutch Politician
quotes.Name: Gijs de Vries

quotes.Text: When you tell your truth, you are coming from a real place, so you are automatically a leader.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mary J. Blige

quotes.Text: When you have learned compassion for yourself, compassion for others is automatic.
quotes.Title: Sri Lankan Clergyman
quotes.Name: Henepola Gunaratana

quotes.Text: In the real world, words don't automatically translate into deeds.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Kathleen Troia McFarland
